verses.text_plain: We have heard with our ears, O God, our fathers have told us, what work thou didst in their days, in the times of old.
verses.verse_html:
1We have heard with our ears, O God, our fathers have told us, what work thou didst in their days, in the times of old. ▼
▼ Maschil: or, of instruction

footnotes.body_html: ▼ Maschil: or, of instruction

verses.text_plain: How thou didst drive out the heathen with thy hand, and plantedst them; how thou didst afflict the people, and cast them out.
verses.verse_html: 2How thou didst drive out the heathen with thy hand, and plantedst them; how thou didst afflict the people, and cast them out.

verses.text_plain: For they got not the land in possession by their own sword, neither did their own arm save them: but thy right hand, and thine arm, and the light of thy countenance, because thou hadst a favour unto them.
verses.verse_html: 3For they got not the land in possession by their own sword, neither did their own arm save them: but thy right hand, and thine arm, and the light of thy countenance, because thou hadst a favour unto them.

verses.text_plain: Thou art my King, O God: command deliverances for Jacob.
verses.verse_html: 4Thou art my King, O God: command deliverances for Jacob.

verses.text_plain: Through thee will we push down our enemies: through thy name will we tread them under that rise up against us.
verses.verse_html: 5Through thee will we push down our enemies: through thy name will we tread them under that rise up against us.

tokens.text: Through thee will we push down

verses.text_plain: For I will not trust in my bow, neither shall my sword save me.
verses.verse_html: 6For I will not trust in my bow, neither shall my sword save me.

verses.text_plain: But thou hast saved us from our enemies, and hast put them to shame that hated us.
verses.verse_html: 7But thou hast saved us from our enemies, and hast put them to shame that hated us.

tokens.text: and hast put them to shame

verses.text_plain: In God we boast all the day long, and praise thy name for ever. Selah.
verses.verse_html: 8In God we boast all the day long, and praise thy name for ever. Selah.

verses.text_plain: But thou hast cast off, and put us to shame; and goest not forth with our armies.
verses.verse_html: 9But thou hast cast off, and put us to shame; and goest not forth with our armies.

verses.text_plain: Thou makest us to turn back from the enemy: and they which hate us spoil for themselves.
verses.verse_html: 10Thou makest us to turn back from the enemy: and they which hate us spoil for themselves.

verses.text_plain: Thou hast given us like sheep appointed for meat; and hast scattered us among the heathen.
verses.verse_html:
11Thou hast given us like sheep appointed for meat; and hast scattered us among the heathen. ▼
▼ like…: Heb. as sheep of meat

footnotes.body_text: ▼ like…: Heb. as sheep of meat
footnotes.body_html: ▼ like…: Heb. as sheep of meat

verses.text_plain: Thou sellest thy people for nought, and dost not increase thy wealth by their price.
verses.verse_html:
12Thou sellest thy people for nought, and dost not increase thy wealth by their price. ▼
▼ for…: Heb. without riches

footnotes.body_html: ▼ for…: Heb. without riches

verses.text_plain: Thou makest us a reproach to our neighbours, a scorn and a derision to them that are round about us.
verses.verse_html: 13Thou makest us a reproach to our neighbours, a scorn and a derision to them that are round about us.

tokens.text: to them that are round about

verses.text_plain: Thou makest us a byword among the heathen, a shaking of the head among the people.
verses.verse_html: 14Thou makest us a byword among the heathen, a shaking of the head among the people.

verses.text_plain: My confusion is continually before me, and the shame of my face hath covered me,
verses.verse_html: 15My confusion is continually before me, and the shame of my face hath covered me,

verses.text_plain: For the voice of him that reproacheth and blasphemeth; by reason of the enemy and avenger.
verses.verse_html: 16For the voice of him that reproacheth and blasphemeth; by reason of the enemy and avenger.

verses.text_plain: All this is come upon us; yet have we not forgotten thee, neither have we dealt falsely in thy covenant.
verses.verse_html: 17All this is come upon us; yet have we not forgotten thee, neither have we dealt falsely in thy covenant.

tokens.text: upon us; yet have we not forgotten
thee, neither have we dealt falsely

verses.text_plain: Our heart is not turned back, neither have our steps declined from thy way;
verses.verse_html:
18Our heart is not turned back, neither have our steps declined from thy way; ▼
▼ steps: or, goings

verses.text_plain: Though thou hast sore broken us in the place of dragons, and covered us with the shadow of death.
verses.verse_html: 19Though thou hast sore broken us in the place of dragons, and covered us with the shadow of death.

tokens.text: us with the shadow of death

verses.text_plain: If we have forgotten the name of our God, or stretched out our hands to a strange god;
verses.verse_html: 20If we have forgotten the name of our God, or stretched out our hands to a strange god;

verses.text_plain: Shall not God search this out? for he knoweth the secrets of the heart.
verses.verse_html: 21Shall not God search this out? for he knoweth the secrets of the heart.

verses.text_plain: Yea, for thy sake are we killed all the day long; we are counted as sheep for the slaughter.
verses.verse_html: 22Yea, for thy sake are we killed all the day long; we are counted as sheep for the slaughter.

tokens.text: Yea, for thy sake are we killed

verses.text_plain: Awake, why sleepest thou, O Lord? arise, cast us not off for ever.
verses.verse_html: 23Awake, why sleepest thou, O Lord? arise, cast us not off for ever.

verses.text_plain: Wherefore hidest thou thy face, and forgettest our affliction and our oppression?
verses.verse_html: 24Wherefore hidest thou thy face, and forgettest our affliction and our oppression?

verses.text_plain: For our soul is bowed down to the dust: our belly cleaveth unto the earth.
verses.verse_html: 25For our soul is bowed down to the dust: our belly cleaveth unto the earth.

verses.text_plain: Arise for our help, and redeem us for thy mercies’ sake.
verses.verse_html:
26Arise for our help, and redeem us for thy mercies’ sake. ▼
▼ for our…: Heb. a help for us

footnotes.body_text: ▼ for our…: Heb. a help for us
footnotes.body_html: ▼ for our…: Heb. a help for us
